questions.question_text: What could cause a high %RDY value?
What are two advantages of deploying a VDS as compared to a VSS? (Choose two.)

choices.E: Uplinks are allowed to be configured in an Active/Standby configuration.
choices.B: Data center setup and administration are simplified by centralization network configuration.
choices.A: There is IPv6 support for a VDS.

questions.question_text: Which migration technique could be used to move a VM between vCenters while the VM is powered on.

discussion.content:
Must be: D

correct answer is Shared nothhing Vsphere Vmotion

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/6.7/com.vmware.vsphere.vcenterhost.doc/GUID-D19EA1CB-5222-49F9-A002-4F8692B92D63.html

Next on the list is Cross vCenter vMotion. This is something that came up fairly frequent when talking about vMotion, will we ever have the ability to move a VM to a new vCenter Server instance? Well as of vSphere 6.0 this is indeed possible. Not only can you move between vCenter Servers but you can do this with all the different migration types there are: change compute / storage / network. You can even do it without having a shared datastore between the source and destination vCenter aka “shared nothing migration. This functionality will come in handy when you are migrating to a different vCenter instance or even when you are migrating workloads to a different location.

Why not Storage Vmotion?
The Storage vMotion changes only the datastore
Having another look at this one......

questions.question_text:
A vSphere administrator is performing a greenfield vSphere deployment with these requirements:
✑ vCenter Server sized for 100 ESXi hosts and 1000 virtual machines
✑ Each ESXi Host with 512 LUNs and 2048 paths mapped from Dell EMC XtremIO Storage Array
Which vCenter Server Appliance deployment size meets the requirements?

A vSphere Administrator configures Quick Boot to restart an ESXi host without rebooting the physical hardware.
In order to troubleshoot any ESXi Quick Boot issues which log file needs to be reviewed?
